content: <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Idaho Department of Water Resources</origin><pubdate>Octobe03</pubdate><title>American Falls Legacy Ground Water Management Area</title><edition>October 2003</edition><geoform>vector digital data</geoform><serinfo /><pubinfo><pubplace>Boise, Idaho</pubplace><publish>Idaho Department of Water Resources</publish></pubinfo><onlink><URL:http://www.idwr.state.id.us/gisdata/iddata.htm></onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>and Purpose: Idaho Code 42-233 a and b "A Critical Ground Management Area (CGMA) is all or part of a ground water basin that does not have sufficient gound water to provide a reasonably safe supply for irrigation or other uses at the current or projected rates of withdrawl. The Director of IDWR can deny an application for a proposed use if the point of diversion les within the designated area and may require water users to report diversions or other information. A Ground Water Management Area (GWMA) is all or part of a ground water basin that may be approaching the conditions of a CGMA. Applications for new water appropriations may be approved only after it is determined that sufficient supply is available and other prior water rights will not be injured. The Director may require reporting of water use by water users within the area." Idaho Department of Water Resources Open-File Report Ground Water Management Areas in Idaho: Overview as of 1998. Helen Harringtion, Shane Bendixsen.</abstract><purpose>This dataset maintains the former extent of the American Falls Ground Water Management Area.</purpose></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>Octobe03</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>current as of October 2003</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>As needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-113.590885</westbc><eastbc>-112.173942</eastbc><northbc>43.380948</northbc><southbc>42.576751</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><theme><themekey>Ground Water Management Areas: Banbury Hot Springs, Bancroft-Lund, Bear River, Bigwood River, Boise Front, Bruneau-Grandview, Lindsay Creek, Mountain Home, Southeast Boise, Twin Falls, Rathdrum Prairie</themekey><themekt>ESRI Geography Network Thesaurus</themekt></theme><place><placekt>None</placekt><placekey /></place></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>Digitized at 1:100,000</useconst><datacred>Helen Harringtion</datacred><native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722</native><crossref><citeinfo><origin>Idaho Department of Water Resources</origin><pubdate>December 1999</pubdate><title> Idaho Department of Water Resources Open-File Report Ground Water Management Areas in Idaho: Overview as of 1998. The Director of IDWR can deny an application for a proposed use if the point of diversion les within the designated area and may require water users to report diversions or other information. A Ground Water Management Area (GWMA) is all or part of a ground water basin that may be approaching the conditions of a CGMA.
